urls.title: Announcing manage blocks for Twitter API v2
urls.description: Blocking accounts is core to maintaining the health and safety of the public conversation on Twitter. Today, we are excited to announce the launch of the new manage blocks endpoints into Twitter API v2. With the manage blocks endpoints, you can build safer experiences for people on Twitter or block accounts programmatically based on previous engagements. You can also unblock accounts after a given period of time or based on criteria that you determine. What’s available The manage blocks endpoi...

urls.title: Announcing Twitter API v2 Likes lookup and blocks lookup
urls.description: Today, we are excited to announce the launch of Likes and blocks lookup endpoints. This release brings the Twitter API v2 a little bit closer to achieving v1.1 parity and delivers net new Likes functionality, only available on v2. Likes lookup Liking Tweets is one of the core features people use to engage in the public conversation on Twitter. With endpoints in our Likes lookup endpoint group, you can see a list of accounts that have liked a specified Tweet, or which Tweets a specified account...

urls.title: Announcing monthly office hours for the academic research product track
urls.description: We are excited to offer office hours for academic researchers that are using the Academic Research product track on the new Twitter API. This is an opportunity for users of this new product track to get their technical questions answered, and helping you get research data with the v2 API. Most office hours will be held on the last Thursday of every month, from 10:00 am PST to 11:30 am PST. We will also try and accommodate other timezones for some of these sessions. How does it work? referenced_tweets.text: Meet one of the useful Twitter bots out there: @ThreadReaderApp, unroll! It makes threads like this easier to read and share. Today, we’ll hear from the bot itself! https://t.co/tBFlJB3m3o

“In the 20th century, managers managed humans, but in the 21st century, humans will manage robots. It is my aim to make this as painless a transition as possible,” says the bot. “I have observed that humans do things very slowly, but I can do things faster – and I am tireless!”

urls.title: Removing support for Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines
urls.description: Update as of May 6th, 2021: We plan to extend the Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines deprecation beyond June 23rd. This move will hopefully allow developers to make a smoother transition away from these timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. Once we have a new retirement date, we’ll update this forum post. In the meantime, please let us know if you have any questions on our forums. Today we’re sharing our plans for the future of embedded timeline widgets. Th...

referenced_tweets.text:
This change will help us focus on delivering value to the >99% of people currently using Profiles & Lists timelines. You should see these features become faster, easier to use, and more up-to-date with Twitter features and functionality. 

Learn more 📖

https://t.co/HzeJLglpRn
A few months ago we shared plans to retire the embedded Collection, Likes, and Moments timelines. Today, we are extending the retirement date beyond June 23rd. https://t.co/qDbtGzn8KB

author.name: Twitter Dev
author.description: The voice of the #TwitterDev team and your official source for updates, news, and events, related to the #TwitterAPI.

text:
We want to enable a smooth transition away from these embedded timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. We'll keep you informed and will update the following forum post when we define a new retirement date.

urls.title: Removing support for Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines
urls.description: Update as of May 6th, 2021: We plan to extend the Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines deprecation beyond June 23rd. This move will hopefully allow developers to make a smoother transition away from these timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. Once we have a new retirement date, we’ll update this forum post. In the meantime, please let us know if you have any questions on our forums. Today we’re sharing our plans for the future of embedded timeline widgets. Th...

referenced_tweets.text:
This change will help us focus on delivering value to the >99% of people currently using Profiles & Lists timelines. You should see these features become faster, easier to use, and more up-to-date with Twitter features and functionality. 

Learn more 📖

https://t.co/HzeJLglpRn

urls.title: Announcing new manage mutes endpoints for the Twitter API v2
urls.description: Today, we are excited to announce the launch of the new manage mutes endpoints into Twitter API v2. Mute is a feature that allows you to remove an account’s Tweets from your timeline without unfollowing or blocking that account. With the manage mutes endpoints, you can build safer, more comfortable experiences for people on Twitter, by giving them more control over the content they see. What’s available The manage mutes endpoints enable you to mute or unmute a specific account on behalf of an ...

text:
Does unfollowing or blocking sometimes feel a bit too harsh? Consider muting instead.

You can now build with the manage mutes endpoints on the #TwitterAPI v2 to give people more control over the content they see on Twitter. https://t.co/2hYlzsnLDC

urls.title: Removing support for Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines
urls.description: Update as of May 6th, 2021: We plan to extend the Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines deprecation beyond June 23rd. This move will hopefully allow developers to make a smoother transition away from these timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. Once we have a new retirement date, we’ll update this forum post. In the meantime, please let us know if you have any questions on our forums. Today we’re sharing our plans for the future of embedded timeline widgets. Th...

referenced_tweets.text:
This change will help us focus on delivering value to the >99% of people currently using Profiles & Lists timelines. You should see these features become faster, easier to use, and more up-to-date with Twitter features and functionality. 

Learn more 📖

https://t.co/HzeJLglpRn
A few months ago we shared plans to retire the embedded Collection, Likes, and Moments timelines. Today, we are extending the retirement date beyond June 23rd. https://t.co/qDbtGzn8KB

author.name: Twitter Dev
author.description: The voice of the #TwitterDev team and your official source for updates, news, and events, related to the #TwitterAPI.

text:
We want to enable a smooth transition away from these embedded timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. We'll keep you informed and will update the following forum post when we define a new retirement date. 
https://t.co/HzeJLglpRn

urls.description: UC Davis and Max Planck Institute for Human Development use Twitter data to study how people adapt to climate change

urls.description: Update as of May 6th, 2021: We plan to extend the Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines deprecation beyond June 23rd. This move will hopefully allow developers to make a smoother transition away from these timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. Once we have a new retirement date, we’ll update this forum post. In the meantime, please let us know if you have any questions on our forums. Today we’re sharing our plans for the future of embedded timeline widgets. Th...

urls.title: Removing support for Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines
urls.description: Update as of May 6th, 2021: We plan to extend the Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines deprecation beyond June 23rd. This move will hopefully allow developers to make a smoother transition away from these timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. Once we have a new retirement date, we’ll update this forum post. In the meantime, please let us know if you have any questions on our forums. Today we’re sharing our plans for the future of embedded timeline widgets. Th...

referenced_tweets.text:
This change will help us focus on delivering value to the >99% of people currently using Profiles & Lists timelines. You should see these features become faster, easier to use, and more up-to-date with Twitter features and functionality. 

Learn more 📖

https://t.co/HzeJLglpRn
A few months ago we shared plans to retire the embedded Collection, Likes, and Moments timelines. Today, we are extending the retirement date beyond June 23rd. https://t.co/qDbtGzn8KB

author.name: Twitter Dev
author.description: The voice of the #TwitterDev team and your official source for updates, news, and events, related to the #TwitterAPI.

text:
We want to enable a smooth transition away from these embedded timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. We'll keep you informed and will update the following forum post when we define a new retirement date.

urls.title: Removing support for Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines
urls.description: Update as of May 6th, 2021: We plan to extend the Embedded Like, Collection, and Moment Timelines deprecation beyond June 23rd. This move will hopefully allow developers to make a smoother transition away from these timelines towards the supported Profile and Lists Timelines. Once we have a new retirement date, we’ll update this forum post. In the meantime, please let us know if you have any questions on our forums. Today we’re sharing our plans for the future of embedded timeline widgets. Th...

urls.title: Announcing Twitter API v2 Likes lookup and blocks lookup
urls.description: Today, we are excited to announce the launch of Likes and blocks lookup endpoints. This release brings the Twitter API v2 a little bit closer to achieving v1.1 parity and delivers net new Likes functionality, only available on v2. Likes lookup Liking Tweets is one of the core features people use to engage in the public conversation on Twitter. With endpoints in our Likes lookup endpoint group, you can see a list of accounts that have liked a specified Tweet, or which Tweets a specified account...

referenced_tweets.text: Meet one of the useful Twitter bots out there: @ThreadReaderApp, unroll! It makes threads like this easier to read and share. Today, we’ll hear from the bot itself! https://t.co/tBFlJB3m3o

“In the 20th century, managers managed humans, but in the 21st century, humans will manage robots. It is my aim to make this as painless a transition as possible,” says the bot. “I have observed that humans do things very slowly, but I can do things faster – and I am tireless!”

urls.title: Announcing Twitter API v2 Likes lookup and blocks lookup
urls.description: Today, we are excited to announce the launch of Likes and blocks lookup endpoints. This release brings the Twitter API v2 a little bit closer to achieving v1.1 parity and delivers net new Likes functionality, only available on v2. Likes lookup Liking Tweets is one of the core features people use to engage in the public conversation on Twitter. With endpoints in our Likes lookup endpoint group, you can see a list of accounts that have liked a specified Tweet, or which Tweets a specified account...

referenced_tweets.text:
The blocks and Likes lookup endpoints are now available on the Twitter API v2. 

Learn more about these endpoints, including new functionality only available on v2! 
https://t.co/96tlseTmTS

#TwitterAPI #EarlyAccess #v2

urls.title: Announcing manage blocks for Twitter API v2
urls.description: Blocking accounts is core to maintaining the health and safety of the public conversation on Twitter. Today, we are excited to announce the launch of the new manage blocks endpoints into Twitter API v2. With the manage blocks endpoints, you can build safer experiences for people on Twitter or block accounts programmatically based on previous engagements. You can also unblock accounts after a given period of time or based on criteria that you determine. What’s available The manage blocks endpoi...

text:
Introducing the manage blocks endpoints to the #TwitterAPI v2. These endpoints are crucial for developers who want to help maintain and improve the health of the public conversation on Twitter.  Learn more 
https://t.co/8ayivhifZE

referenced_tweets.text: Meet one of the useful Twitter bots out there: @ThreadReaderApp, unroll! It makes threads like this easier to read and share. Today, we’ll hear from the bot itself! https://t.co/tBFlJB3m3o

“In the 20th century, managers managed humans, but in the 21st century, humans will manage robots. It is my aim to make this as painless a transition as possible,” says the bot. “I have observed that humans do things very slowly, but I can do things faster – and I am tireless!”
